content:
衛生福利部民國107年7月20日 衛部秘字第1072161286號通知單註銷密等
院醫設附院學醫學大灣臺立國 NATIONAL TAIWAN UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL No. 1, CHANG-TE STREET TAIPEI, TAIWAN REPUBLIC OF CHINA
May 9, 1963
To whom it may concern:
1. Immediately after her graduation from the Department of Agricultural Chemistry National Taiwan University in 1955, the applicant worked as an assistant of Prof. C. C. Yen, Director of the Department of Bacteriology Medical College, National Taiwan University for two years, during which she received basic training in general bacteriology and serology. Thereafter, she has been assigned as the chief technician of Serological Section of the Clinical Laboratory in the University Hospital. The undersigned would consider her background, both educational and profes- sional, as most qualified for the proposed training.
As regard to the applicant's personality, the undersigned would comment that she is both a hard-working technician and a self-conscious house-wife of an amazing character.
She is 30 with an excellent health and used to be an athlete during her school years.
2. She is comparatively slow in language, but her hearing and speaking abilities in English is considered sufficient for the proposed training courses. to be
3. Conaught Institute, University of Toronto, Toronto, Canada. The length of training is twelve months.
4. The applicant will work in the Taiwan Serum and Vaccine Laboratory alleon her return home. She will be responsible for producing and standardi- zation/the polio-vaccine.locally. Her position will be transfered to the above mentioned Vaccine Laboratory by the end of July 1964.
Sze-Piao Yang, M.D. Chief, Department of Clinical Pathology.
12th Academia Historica
5
